column4: i tried the link for the viewing of the windows partition in ubuntu, and im kind of lost... can you give me the link again
the link should just tell you to install and run ntfs-config
what happens exactly?  How doesn't it work?
well i instaleld it, but it isnt working.. it doesnt show up in my browser it doesnt work when i do java apps in my browser
what package did you install?  And have you restarted your browser?
it qwasnt a pack it was from the site and dur i restarted my browser
right.  You should use the packages from the repositories.  They set things up for you.  You need to install the sun-java6-plugin package if you want sun's java plugin
tell me the output of this command please: uname -m
sun does not provide a 64bit java plugin.  Your only options on 64bit are to either use an open java like gcjwebplugin or to install a 32bit firefox as described in !java64
where can i get a 32bit firefox then
oops, issue was on my end.  That's conky.  Why do you want to compile it?  It's in the repositories
what does that have to do with anything?
tell us the output of: uname -m
tell us the output of: uname -m
now go bug sun about them not providing a java plugin
sun does not provide a 64bit java plugin for linux.  Either use an open java like gcjwebplugin or install 32bit firefox (see !java64)
